xxl.core.cursors.filters
Class Remover<E>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.SecureDecoratorCursor<E>
      xxl.core.cursors.filters.Remover<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by this iteration.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Iterator<E>, Cursor<E>
Direct Known Subclasses:
WhileRemover
public class Remover<E>
extends SecureDecoratorCursor<E>

The remover removes all elements of a given input iteration in a lazy way, i.e., the remove method is called for all elements of the input iterator that are returned by a call to the next method. Each call to the input iteration's next method implies that its remove is called thereafter. So the element returned by next is automatically removed from the underlying data structure. Therefore the caller is not able to traverse the underlying collection again by invoking the reset method.

Note: If the input iteration is given by an object of the class Iterator, i.e., it does not support the peek operation, it is internally wrapped to a cursor.

See Also:
Iterator, Cursor, SecureDecoratorCursor

Remover

public Remover(java.util.Iterator<E> iterator)
Creates a new remover which removes every element of the input iteration that is returned by its next method.

iterator - the input iteration which elements should be removed.
Method Detail

next

public E next()
       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
              java.util.NoSuchElementException
Returns the next element in the iteration. This element will not be accessible by some of the cursor's methods, e.g., update or remove, until a call to next or peek occurs, because it is removed from the underlying data structure at the same time.

Specified by:
next in interface java.util.Iterator<E>
Specified by:
next in interface Cursor<E>
Overrides:
next in class SecureDecoratorCursor<E>
Returns:
the next element in the iteration.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the cursor is already closed when this method is called.
java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the iteration has no more elements.
